Firefox 16 update - New command line

Found a new update for Firefox this morning on twitter @mozhacks

Firefox now has built in a console environment, very handy for shortcuts.

Once updated press 'Shift F2'... type in 'help' in the command line and some basic commands will be listed.

  • I managed to take a screenshot of the page, no need for add-ons.
  • List/add/delete cookies.
  • The 'tilt' command is quite useful, I've seen this before in an earlier version of Firefox. (it allows you too see the div nesting in 3D).

Check it out.

More info: http://www.webmonkey.com/2012/10/firefox-16-offers-new-tools-for-web-developers/
